Package tests

Class CivControllerTest

java.lang.Object
tests.CivControllerTest
@TestMethodOrder(org.junit.jupiter.api.MethodOrderer.OrderAnnotation.class)
public class CivControllerTest
extends java.lang.Object
Tests the methods of CivController. Also tests some of the components and resources classes.
Author:
Connie Sun, Ryan Smith, Luke Hankins, Tim Gavlick

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    CivControllerTest()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    (package private) void attackOwnKillEnemy()
    Tests that a player is not allowed to attack their own unit.
    (package private) void testBasics()
    Tests the basics of the game.
    (package private) void testComputerDestroyCity()
    Tests that a computer player will destroy a city and win
    (package private) void testGameSave()
    Tests that the controller's start and end turn methods work correctly.
    (package private) void testResources()
    Tests the three resources classes and that their getters work correctly.
    (package private) void testUnits()
    Tests that the methods shared by all units work correctly.
    (package private) void testUnlockableUnits()
    Tests the special units (militia, cavalry, and swordsman) that can be unlocked with resources

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • CivControllerTest

      public CivControllerTest()

  • Method Details

    • testBasics

      @Test @Order(1) void testBasics()
      Tests the basics of the game. Allows the computer to win. Does not test resources or unlockable units.

    • testComputerDestroyCity

      @Test @Order(2) void testComputerDestroyCity()
      Tests that a computer player will destroy a city and win

    • attackOwnKillEnemy

      @Test @Order(3) void attackOwnKillEnemy()
      Tests that a player is not allowed to attack their own unit. Tests that a player can kill an enemy. Also tests that a unit correctly dies in a counterattack.

    • testUnlockableUnits

      @Test @Order(4) void testUnlockableUnits()
      Tests the special units (militia, cavalry, and swordsman) that can be unlocked with resources

    • testUnits

      @Test @Order(5) void testUnits()
      Tests that the methods shared by all units work correctly.

    • testResources

      @Test @Order(6) void testResources()
      Tests the three resources classes and that their getters work correctly.

    • testGameSave

      @Test @Order(7) void testGameSave()
      Tests that the controller's start and end turn methods work correctly. Deletes the old saved game state.
